an6.13:4.1: “Mendicants, there are these six elements of escape.
an6.13:4.4: ‘I’ve developed the heart’s release by love. I’ve cultivated it, made it my vehicle and my basis, kept it up, consolidated it, and properly implemented it.
an6.13:4.5: Yet somehow ill will still occupies my mind.’
an6.13:4.6: They should be told, ‘Not so, venerable!
an6.13:4.8: Don’t misrepresent the Buddha, for misrepresentation of the Buddha is not good. And the Buddha would not say that.
an6.13:4.9: It’s impossible, reverend, it cannot happen that the heart’s release by love has been developed and properly implemented,
an6.13:4.10: yet somehow ill will still occupies the mind.
an6.13:4.11: For it is the heart’s release by love that is the escape from ill will.’
an6.13:5.2: ‘I’ve developed the heart’s release by compassion. I’ve cultivated it, made it my vehicle and my basis, kept it up, consolidated it, and properly implemented it.
an6.13:5.3: Yet somehow the thought of harming still occupies my mind.’
an6.13:5.4: They should be told, ‘Not so, venerable! …
an6.13:5.9: For it is the heart’s release by compassion that is the escape from thoughts of harm.’
an6.13:6.2: ‘I’ve developed the heart’s release by rejoicing. I’ve cultivated it, made it my vehicle and my basis, kept it up, consolidated it, and properly implemented it.
an6.13:6.3: Yet somehow negativity still occupies my mind.’
an6.13:6.4: They should be told, ‘Not so, venerable! …
an6.13:6.9: For it is the heart’s release by rejoicing that is the escape from negativity.’
an6.13:7.2: ‘I’ve developed the heart’s release by equanimity. I’ve cultivated it, made it my vehicle and my basis, kept it up, consolidated it, and properly implemented it.
an6.13:7.3: Yet somehow desire still occupies my mind.’
an6.13:7.4: They should be told, ‘Not so, venerable! …
an6.13:7.9: For it is the heart’s release by equanimity that is the escape from desire.’
an6.13:8.2: ‘I’ve developed the signless release of the heart. I’ve cultivated it, made it my vehicle and my basis, kept it up, consolidated it, and properly implemented it.
an6.13:8.3: Yet somehow my consciousness still follows after signs.’
an6.13:8.4: They should be told, ‘Not so, venerable! …
an6.13:8.9: For it is the signless release of the heart that is the escape from all signs.’
an6.13:9.2: ‘I’m rid of the construct “I am”. And I don’t regard anything as “I am this”.
an6.13:9.3: Yet somehow the dart of doubt and indecision still occupies my mind.’
an6.13:9.4: They should be told, ‘Not so, venerable!
an6.13:9.6: Don’t misrepresent the Buddha, for misrepresentation of the Buddha is not good. And the Buddha would not say that.
an6.13:9.7: It’s impossible, reverend, it cannot happen that the construct “I am” has been done away with, and nothing is regarded as “I am this”,
an6.13:9.8: yet somehow the dart of doubt and indecision still occupy the mind.
an6.13:9.9: For it is the uprooting of the conceit “I am” that is the escape from the dart of doubt and indecision.’
an6.13:10.1: These are the six elements of escape.”
